result.execSummary:
The defendant Dean Allen Pauliot Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Dean Allen Pauliot in court with attorney Stevens Tomchuk Kelly.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this is a motion to terminate the DPA and states that the defendant is not contesting the matter.  Atty Kelly agrees.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Court will terminate the DPA and finds the defendant guilty.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.

BY THE COURT:  Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge

bond to be applied and the balance will be paid today
Motion hearing on July 19, 2017 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Dean Allen Pauliot in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant off the record stated that his Attorney, Tom Kelly was going to be here today.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and states that Atty Kelly was supposed to appear today.  

BY THE COURT:  Court will grant one additional reset on the matter.
bond continued  Motion hearing scheduled for July 19, 2017 at 11:45 am.

Attorney Thomas Kelly in court on behalf of Atty Lucareli.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this was a motion to terminate the DPA based on the defendant failed to provide proof of community service.  

BY THE COURT:  Court will reset.
bond continued.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 7, 2017 at 11:30 am.

Motion hearing on April 20, 2017 at 11:45 am.
in Support of Motion to Terminate Deferred Proscecution Agreement
to Terminate Deferred Prosecution Agreement

Defendant Dean Allen Pauliot in court. Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Steven Michael Lucareli appeared by phone means for Defendant Dean Allen Pauliot.
Atty Hendee states that the parties have resolution.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of:  12 months with conditions.  
Atty Lucareli agrees.   Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and approves and signs the 12 month DPA with conditions.

Attorney Steven Michael Lucareli appeared by phone means for Defendant Dean Allen Pauliot. Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Dean Allen Pauliot in court.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Court finds probable cause.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for Return and Pre-Trial.
